item.title: melbourne add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "(When asked what he thought of Western civilization): 'I think it would be a good idea." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: melbourne add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "Tolle, lege: take up and read." -- St. Augustine

item.title: melbourne add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He who opens a school door, closes a prison." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: melbourne add a quote by St. Paul
item.description: "To everything there is a season, and a time to every purpose under heaven." -- St. Paul

item.title: melbourne add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "Miracles are not contrary to nature but only contrary to what we know about nature. " -- St. Augustine

item.title: melbourne add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "They wrote in the old days that it is sweet and fitting to die for one's country. But in modern war, there is nothing sweet nor fitting in your dying. You will die like a dog for no good reason." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: melbourne add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: melbourne add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "And one by one the nights between our separated cities are joined to the night that unites us." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: melbourne add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "In what language does rain fall over tormented cities?" -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: melbourne add a quote by Bertolt Brecht.
item.description: "There are men who struggle for a day, and they are good. There are others who struggle for a year, and they are better. There are some who struggle many years, and they are better still. But there are those who struggle all their lives, and these are the indispensible ones." -- Bertolt Brecht.
